title: Leonard Kreusch 2014 Bernkasteler Kurfürstlay Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Despite its honey and pressed-apple sweetness, there's a decidedly earthy, savory tone to this light-bodied Spätlese. Citrusy acidity lends refreshment to the midpalate before a slightly dusty pollen and saffron-spiced finish. Drink now through 2018.

title: Les Rocailles 2015 Rosé (Vin de Savoie)
description: The wine is round and full in the mouth. The acidity gives a fresh character to the ripe caramel flavors that shine through the light texture. It is a wine that needs food, with its lively acidity giving a dry, mineral aftertaste.

title: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2015 Mireille Rosé (Mediterranée)
description: Ripe and full in the mouth, this wine that comes from a range of vineyards across the region is a blend of 50-50 Syrah and Muscat. The Muscat gives a perfumed and honeyed character that is delicious and brings out the ripe, light tannins of the Syrah.

title: Don Olegario 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Mild corn and hay aromas render the nose less than fresh and fully clean. A chunky palate has bracing acidity, while a stalky element gets in the way of stone-fruit flavors. Pithy bitterness is a factor on the finish.

title: Dopff & Irion 2014 Crustacés White (Alsace)
description: Slightly high-toned hints precede nuances of pear and lemon. The palate is light, dry and crisp, finishing with a fresh, clean lemon note.

title: Duca di Salaparuta 2015 Colomba Palatino White (Terre Siciliane)
description: This offers subdued aromas suggesting orchard fruit and pressed yellow flower. The straightforward, rather lean palate offers citrus, saline and a hint of green pear alongside fresh acidity.

title: Melée 2012 Grenache (California)
description: This full-bodied and earthy-tasting wine has berries and cherries in the aroma and beefy, savory flavors that fill out the rather tannic texture nicely.

title: Allimant-Laugner 2014 Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: A faint scent of red cherry greets the nose and also makes a brief appearance on the fresh, clean and rather light body. This is slightly rustic but is honest and straightforward. Drink soon.

title: Avia 2014 Hand Harvested Estate Bottled Pinot Grigio (Primorska)
description: Aromas of white flowers and ripe banana lead the way to flavors of tart green apple and melon. The finish is pleasant but slightly acidic.

title: Vieil Armand 2014 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Soft notes of apple compote perfume the nose. The palate has the same soft but distinct freshness of ripe, juicy apple. The friendly aromas could do with more definition on the palate, but this is a simple, clean wine.

title: Cantine Foschini 2015  Falanghina del Sannio
description: This has aromas of yellow flower and orchard fruit while the rather lean palate shows green pear, saline and obvious alcohol. A note of bitter almond closes it down.

title: Carbó NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: Woody notes of sawdust and cinnamon stick drive a mostly fruitless nose. This feels lean and fresh, but foamy. Dry, salty and savory more than fruity, this blend of Trapat and Garnacha finishes steady, with notes of citrus fruits.

title: Château de l'Orangerie 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This wine is refreshing and packed with red fruits. With acidity, a tangy texture and a touch of tannin, everything is there. Light and fruity, it is ready to drink.

title: Bodegas y Viñedos Tábula 2015 Damana Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Prickly nettle, grapefruit and jalapeño aromas feed into a crisp, lemony palate with tangy lemon-lime flavors that last a good while. There's citric carry over onto a fresh but basic finish.

title: Concha y Toro 2014 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Carmenère (Peumo)
description: Prune, tobacco and wild berry aromas are jumbled together. This is big, grabby and a touch clumsy, with heavily oaked flavors of hickory and burnt corn running alongside mint and berry. A resiny, oaky finish tastes smothering.

title: Cycles Gladiator 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)
description: Red cherry, ripe cranberry, blackberry and a rocky minerality show on the nose of this once popular twist-top, bicycle-sporting wine that's back on the market. The palate is very fruit forward with very ripe blackberry and red cherry fruit, enough grip to catch attention and a cigar box complexity.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2015 Rava Blackjack Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Sliced Gravenstein apples, guava tropicality, sliced lemon, passion fruit and a touch of white pepper show on the nose of this exuberant bottling. The sip is quite fruity and a tad sweet, showing jubilant pineapple and ripe stone-fruit flavors reminiscent of Juicy Fruit gum.

title: Unfiltered Blonde 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Grapes come from both the Knights Valley and Napa County for this wine, named by former model and Real Housewife Brandi Glanville. Bold as Brandi, it shows a hit of oak around thick waves of anise, vanilla and melon, ready for anything.

title: Sobon Estate 2013 Barbera (Amador County)
description: Fresh, bright aromas including raspberry and strawberry tag rich baking spices, and oak-induced maple syrup flavors for an appealing, jammy personality.

title: Château la France 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: As pale-colored as possible, this wine still manages a light tannic edge as well as red-fruit flavors. Crisp, and clean, it offers lively acidity providing a bright aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Terra di Briganti 2014  Falanghina del Sannio
description: Made with organically cultivated grapes, this has subdued aromas of pressed flower, apple and nut. The somewhat lean, straightforward palate shows lemon, green pear, saline and a touch of bitter almond.

title: Principe di Corleone 2015 Bianca di Corte Grillo (Sicilia)
description: Aromas of yellow flower, citrus and dried herb float out of the glass. The palate is a bit on the lean side, offering lime, grilled sage and bitter almond alongside zesty acidity.

title: Zimri Cellars 2015 Hoot And Howl Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: A lightweight effort with admirably low alcohol, this quaffable wine offers apple sauce flavors, hints of toasted almonds, and a touch of lemon oil. It slips comfortably into a Pinot Grigio style rather than the fleshier Pinot Gris more often found in Oregon.

title: Cramele Recas 2014 Legendary Estate Series Pinot Noir (Romania)
description: This ruby-colored Romanian Pinot Noir has scents of black plum and red cherry and flavors of bright red cherry before a tart finish.

title: Cramele Recas 2015 Dreambird Pinot Grigio (Romania)
description: Lemon zest, citrus blossoms and peach aromas lead the way to tropical fruit flavors in this Romanian Pinot Grigio. It is light bodied with a crisp finish.

title: Cramele Recas 2015 Dreamfish Sauvignon Blanc (Romania)
description: Aromas of banana, mango, and pineapple open to flavors of tropical fruit salad, mango and banana and a soft finish.

title: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2015 Collection Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Earthy notes mix in with fresh Mirabelle plum notes and juicy apples. The palate is fresh, bouncy and light. Drink soon.

title: Château la Verrière 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This is a crisply fruity wine, with tight acidity and a nervy texture. The citrus character dominates, leaving room for only hints of riper red fruits. The aftertaste continues the theme of crisp acidity.

title: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2015 Le Rosé de Mouton Cadet Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: With a predominance of Merlot, this soft, caramel-flavored wine is veering towards off dry. It has an attractive freshness as well as a crisp touch that makes it very drinkable now.

title: Barone di Villagrande 2015 Salina Bianco White (Terre Siciliane)
description: A blend of native grapes Rucignola, Catarratto and Malvasia, this has aromas suggesting pressed yellow flower and dried herb. The palate is somewhat lean, offering citrus, dried Mediterranean herb and a hint of nut.
